												To be quite honest, I spent more time and money on this game than I think it was actually worth. The main problem is that there's a level cap bottleneck, with no real increases in content, which makes the game very linear and dead-ended. It's just not predictable enough for you to be able to anticipate the payout, which leaves you feeling less like a rabbit following a carrot on a stick, and more like you're playing horseshoes with a blindfold on. The game just feels sort of, unfinished.TL:DR It's fun, but not thrilling. Affordable, but overpriced.

												First my profile: 44y, born in France and living in Canada, I am a casual player for the last 25y ( and an adict the first 5y) so I played tons of games from various genre, mostly on PC.I highly recommend this game, mostly because it's fun.I have rarely completed game twice but as I foundly remembered the game, I tried it once more and realized there was a new update that added bounty hunters and realized they re-balanced the game, which likely explain some of the earlier bad score.I somewhat forgot some of the game mechanic but it all came back and I can  say doing it all over again was pure joy.The game has a good mix of strategy, story telling, action and progression.I love to pilote a small fleet and the many options to go about the difficult missions. Some complain the difficulty curve is too high, especially in mid-game, but I would say that it is a welcome challenge as the AI is quite weak and they are many ways to exploit it. There is a bit of grinding but I kind of like it myself being a bit perfectionist with games and liking to explore all there is to see and find secrets so be warned.It's a two man game and I find that inspiring, those guys have talents and I can't wait to put my hand on SPAZ 2 when it comes out.THe graphics are not for everyone but I personally like it and 2D worked for piloting the ships.The music was repetitive but pleasant and I did not get tired of it. I find music can play a bit part of your long term memory of the joy of playing a game and this one is still lingering in my subconcient.Overall a 9/10 for me.

y 7, 2015
												SPAZ is a top-down space grinder. You start with almost nothing and build your way up to the commander of a squad of ships. As you complete story missions, you gain access to larger hangars which means larger ships to command. You can manipulate your enemies and scavange their ships after they've destroyed one another. You can eradicate infections and undermine the local rebellion or authority figures. Pros-Fun! Collecting the various weapons and tools, then customized your ships to find the best combinations is hours of enjoyment.Unique! Not many games I've played have the variety of units and unpredictability of SPAZ. I've seen ships that shouldn't have succeeded destroy others that are twice their size.Cons-Wash, Rinse, Repeat- A bit repetitive at times. Requires lots of time grinding to find the blueprints for all the ships. Not always the most fun, but it DOES make getting your first HUGE ship so rewarding.Angry? Have some Goons- Very easy to manipulate the factions by bribing them with goons (a sort of influence currency). Once you're on their good sides, you can just wait for them to butt heads and collect the cash, goons, data, and blueprints left over from their conflicts. Not super challenging.Braaaaaaains- The Zombies are very unique and sometimes absurdly over powered. Still need to get used to them, but their initial strategies require you to change your thinking ALOT.9/10 BUY IT (ESPECIALLY IF IT'S ON SALE)

18, 2011
												This is really a good game.  And, it's only about 150MB to install.  It's a space exploration, resource gathering, space combat strategy.  I'm not much into RTS games, and this game doesn't play like one.  You have a mother ship, and then control individual ships in your fleet.  You can switch between any ship, and also set up AI for those ships you aren't currently controlling.  The galaxy is proceedurally generated when you start a new game, and you can control the number of star systems up to about 300 total.  Each star system has a level requirement before you can visit it, and you have to deal with the ships guarding the Jump Gates (bribe or destroy) before you can move freely between systems you have access to.Really, try the demo.  The tutorial is for the first system but seems to open up after about the 1st or 2nd mission you take.  This 2 person dev team deserve your money.
